intro: [WRONG START] Plectranthus antongilican, commonly known as the Madagascar nettle, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique appearance and medicinal properties make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
